Based on JRA-5189

Right now you can sort statuses using the up/down arrows but that takes so much longer than it needs to.

Cheers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47736].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
If an Admin specifies a project to allow users who are currently not JIRA Users to create their issues in via email, the project in question is visible to all users who are members of the default jira users group or any group.

There is unfortunately no way to way to restrict which users are able to see the project as users created from email are always added to the jira-users group [as stated here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-185729464.html].

*Feature*
Can a feature be added to the incoming email form that allows users specify which group the users should be added to as this ensures that, other users who do not need to see the project do not have access to it.
* Add a field that allows user specify group that would be able to view the project or 
* Add the group specified in the browse project permission as the group that the users are created in along with the default JIRA users group which would help ensure that the user can view their issues however other users who do not belong to this group would not be able to see the project.
fields.summary: Add a feature that allows users specify group which users created from incoming mail are added to

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Server user, it's possible to disable the Log Work option in Add-ons but specifies this is not possible in Cloud:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+disable+the+Log+Work+option+in+JIRA

Customers would like to disable in Cloud if they plan to use the Tempo Log Work option instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Cloud users to disable the Log Work option from JIRA
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to disable Log Work button in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
Hi,

Invoking method "com.atlassian.jira.issue.AbstractIssue.getAttachments()" from transition a validator in "Create Issue" transition throws a "java.lang.NullPointerException".

Note that the problem appears from a validator, i.e., before execution of post-function "Creates de Issue Originally".

I consider this is a bug, since the correct behavior should be to return attachments provided in Create Issue screen, or an empty collection. The exception is uncatched by JIRA and is shown in UI.

The stack trace looks like this:

2015-12-10 09:05:06,870 http-nio-8080-exec-8 ERROR admin 545x199x1 1u7yt9q 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CreateIssueDetails.jspa [c.f.j.p.workflowToolbox.shared.Parser] *** NullPointerException: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.getStoredAttachments(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.getAttachments(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:185)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.AbstractIssue.getAttachments(AbstractIssue.java:71)
	at com.fca.jira.plugins.workflowToolbox.shared.AttachmentsHelper.getConsolidatedGeneralizedAttachments(AttachmentsHelper.java:74)
	at com.fca.jira.plugins.workflowToolbox.shared.AttachmentsHelper.getAllAttachments(AttachmentsHelper.java:34)
	at com.fca.jira.plugins.workflowToolbox.shared.GeneralizedField.getValue(GeneralizedField.java:2651)
.....

The last calls are from JIRA Workflow Toolbox plugin, which I develop.

Thanks,

Fidel
fields.summary: NullPointerException when calling "Issue.getAttachments()" from "Create Issue" transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47729].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

Previously in JIRA 6.3.x the assign to field had focus, so user could just start typing. This behaviour change since 7.0 where the assign to field does not have focus.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7 onwards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any JIRA issue
# Click 'Assign' button

h3. Expected Results

The assign to field should have focus just like in previous version before 7.0.

h3. Actual Results

The assign to field does not have focus.
 
h3.Workaround

Click on the drop down button to select the assignee.
fields.summary: Assignee field does not have focus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , JIRA doesn't support viewing SVG image from JIRA . So , admin would like to raised a feature to render SVG image to PNG image from JIRA . Then send email notifications using PNG format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Auto render SVG image format to PNG when adding comment or attachment.

h3. Workaround 
Download the files from attachment then view it using SVG supported application or via online . For example http://www.rapidtables.com/web/tools/svg-viewer-editor.htm .
fields.summary: As admin, would like SVG image format render to PNG format when sending email notifications

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to Replicate+
# Download JIRA 7.0.2 Software Linux installer
# Run it with *Root* user
# Finish the Installation.

h4. +Expected Behavior+
JIRA's folders would have the correct permissions for user 'jira' and all files would be created without any issues.

h4. +Actual Behavior+
Jira's folders that are owned by the "jira" user don't have the write permission.
Upon JIRA start, the following error appears in catalina.out:
{noformat}
SEVERE: Unable to create directory for deployment: /opt/atlassian/jira/conf/Catalina/localhost
{noformat}

And the directory above fails to be created.
\\
*Note*: If the installer is ran by another user, all JIRA folders will have their permissions attached to only the user who ran the command, therefore the issue does not reproduce.
\\

h3. +Workaround:+
* [JIRA throws SEVERE message during startup due to Unable to create directory for deployment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+throws+SEVERE+message+during+startup+due+to+Unable+to+create+directory+for+deployment]
fields.summary: JIRA 7.0.2 permission issues when installing as Root

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47715].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the *Create Branch* feature in the *Development Panel* only links to BitBucket Cloud or BitBucket Server (previously known as Stash). The suggestion ticket to allow the creation of branch in Github, *[JRA-35175|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35175]*, has also been closed as it is not in Atlassian's roadmap. 

It is confusing for customers who would like to create branches in Github instead of BitBucket when they are presented with the option to BitBucket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide the option to *Create Branch* in the *Development Panel* if the on available DVCS connection is to Github.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Hide "Create Branch" from Development Panel when DVCS connection is only to Github

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47713].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

we need do give some users the permission to view the members of some groups.

eg.

_User A_ needs to view the members of _Group A, C, D, X,_
_User B_ needs to view the members of _Group B, C, E, F_
_User C_ needs to view the members of _*all* Groups,_
and so on...

Is it possible to add this feature??

This Feature was also requested by JRA-12211.
But JRA-12211 was untruly closed as an duplicate of JRA-11009 *but it isn't quite*!

Cheers,
Marcel
fields.summary: Need to make Members of Groups visible to non-administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47711].

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when an issue is cloned, the Status field is not retained. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the customer the option if we could like to retain the Status field during Issue Cloning.
fields.summary: As a User, I want JIRA give us the option to retain status when cloning an Issue.

fields.description:
Atlassian importer plugin imports issues from different sources, e.g. Bugzilla. If external source contains worktime records (ExternalWorklog class in plugin), Jira imports worktime correctly (the Work Log tab contains correct records). However, it also adds History items, each for every ExternalWorklog item. These History items contain wrong dates: the dates of import, but not the dates of work log items. It is interesting, that the user that logged worktime is set to correct value, but the date of the change is incorrect.

I propose to switch off History while adding worktime records during import. The import script cannot guess when the worktime record was added to external source, so it should just ignore the change and leave it to the plugin to decide.

Setting the history item date to the date of the import when the importer cannot guess is a bad and misleading practice.
fields.summary: Incorrect history date when adding worktime while importing issues

h3. Summary
The activity stream entries from Confluence are not using the configured date/time formats in JIRA's Look and Feel. 
Screenshot: [^DateTime.png] Here, we are using {{dd.MM.yy HH:mm}} in JIRA's Complete Date Time format, but the Confluence stream entries are using its own {{Friday at 08:49}} format.

h3. Environment
Tested on:
* JIRA 7.0.2
* Confluence 5.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Turn off relative dates in JIRA. 
# Go to JIRA's {{Look and Feel}} section, and change the Complete Date Time format to {{dd.MM.yy HH:mm}}.
# Applink JIRA and Confluence. 
# Create some spaces and pages in Confluence.
# Check JIRA's activity stream. 

h3. Expected Results
# All entries in the activity stream should use {{dd.MM.yy HH:mm}} as its date/time format.

h3. Actual Results
Screenshot: [^DateTime.png] 

h3.Workaround
No workarounds.
fields.summary: Activity Stream entries from Confluence using different date/time format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47702].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA ships with a bundled JRE, which will highly useful does not contain diagnostic tools (such as {{jstack}}) that are required for performance troubleshooting, and diagnosing other problems. Admins need to install a JDK to use these tools, which during problematic periods (such as outages) can become a blocker as other teams may maintain servers.

It's a big friction point for customers that we could avoid by providing a JDK that already has those tools.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE.
 
h3. Workaround 

Install a JDK from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html.
fields.summary: Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE

  {panel}

h3. Summary
In previous versions of JIRA, the most recent selected tab when editing a transition would be remembered upon re-opening the transition or opening new browser tabs to edit other transitions while in the same session. Currently, when clicking on a transition to edit it, the Triggers tab is automatically selected regardless of previous selection. When performing an action on a different tab, the page is then refreshed and is back on the Triggers tab. This causes inconvenience when performing changes to multiple transitions, or performing multiple changes on a different tab.

h3. Environment
* v7.1.0-OD-02-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Workflow
# Click on a transition to Edit it
# Select a different tab on this page, for example Conditions
# Navigate back to the Edit Workflow page
# Attempt to re-open the same Transition to edit it, or open a new Transition to Edit
# Each time a new transition is opened up, the Triggers tab is selected by default

h3. Expected Results
The most recent selected tab should be remembered when navigating to other transitions or re-opening transitions. This should work similar to the way tabs are remembered on a JIRA Issue.

h3. Actual Results
The Triggers tab is selected each time, forcing to re-navigate to the correct tab.

h3.Workaround
Manually navigate to the desired tab when editing a transition.
fields.summary: Tabs No Longer Remembered When Editing Transitions on a Workflow

fields.description:
I cannot get the JIRA Helloworld Plugin tutorial to work. (Specifically: https://developer.atlassian.com/docs/getting-started/set-up-the-atlassian-plugin-sdk-and-build-a-project/put-the-final-polish-on-the-project-in-eclipse).

I've run through it a number of times. (I don't even want to tell you how many... ) I've also tried a few other tutorials for Confluence and JIRA and zero luck. I see the same issue with all of them. I'm not sure if there's an issue with how I've setup my dev environment (I'm completely new to JIRA/Confluence development and followed the instructions on how to install the SDK and recommended version of Java, etc.) I have started to see other people posting comments saying that they also cannot get the tutorials to work either, so I'm reaching out for help. For the errors I'm encountering, there is not enough explanation given in the tutorials to understand what is going wrong. If this turns out to be something on my end, I would suggest adding a better explanation of what exactly the plugin creation command generates and how to create these resources without using the auto-generate command.

Here are the details on what's going wrong: 

When I run atlas-run to open JIRA and test the plugin, the Helloworld plugin is disabled. I try to enable it manually and get the following error:

ERROR admin .... /rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.tutorial.helloworld-key [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginInstalledHelper] Cannot determine required plugins, cannot resolve bundle 'com.atlassian.tutorial.helloworld'

After that initial error, it keeps trying to load, and then I finally get a timeout error and the plugin does not load:

ERROR admin ... /rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.tutorial.helloworld-key [c.a.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Unable to start the following plugins due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable: com.atlassian.tutorial.helloworld

It looks like the files generated from the atlas-create-jira-plugin-module command do not yield the same files in the completed version of the tutorial hosted at https://bitbucket.org/atlassian_tutorial/helloworld.git

Running atlas-create-jira-plugin-module yields: 
src/main/java/com/atlassian/tutorial/helloworld/api/MyPluginComponent.java
src/main/java/com/atlassian/tutorial/helloworld/impi/MyPluginComponent.java

Meanwhile, the Bitbucket code has:
src/main/java/com/atlassian/tutorial/helloworld/MyPlugin.java

I'm not sure how to resolve this. Any help is much appreciated!
fields.summary: JIRA and Confluence Plugin Development Tutorials Don't Work

h3. Problem Definition

When linking an issue, currently the user will only receive 10 results when using the "search for an issue" option. This limit=10 is send on the request when pressing the search button and seems to be intentional.

Yet for some instances there are too many similar requests and the 10 issue limit leaves the end-user with a functionality that does not work as desired.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Let the administrator configure the amount of returned results.

h3. Workaround

Use the issue navigator to look up the issue which it has to be linked to, or use a more refined search term.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47694].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when assigning an issue the options available to the assignee field include:
* Unassigned
* Automatic
* And a list of some assignable users
However, there is no automatic way to directly assign an issue back to the reporter (assuming the reporter is assignable), except you have taken particular note of the reporter's ID, and manually enter this into the field. 

For workflows that often involve assigning issues back to the reporter, you may often have to go out of the assign issue dialog to verify the ID of the reporter from the issue view, before coming back to the Assign Issue screen to assign the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option "Assign to Reporter" to the list of suggestions for Assignee field (provided the Reporter is assignable).
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have additional options like 'Assign to Reporter' for the assignee field

h3. Summary Customer reported that when creating custom field (User Picker) and added html tags in description field, text link shows correctly in Custom Field screen under Administration Setting. However when creating new issues, the create issue form for User Picker field shows the HTML code not the text link. h3. Environment N/A h3. Steps to Reproduce # Log-in in JIRA, JIRA Administration -> Issues - Under Field click Custom Field # Click on Add Custom Field -> Search User Picker (Single User) and select it # Enter Field name and HTML code (below) in Description field, click create and select Default Screen or all the screens available in the list then click on update. {code}

HELLO WORLD

Atlassian Website {code} # Back to Custom Field Screen, search the new custom field you created and description shows a text link ( this part is working as expected - see User Picker under Custom image). # Create a new issue, look for the new custom field on the create issue form. Noticed the description field for that User Picker Type is showing HTML code instead Text link (attached snapshot). h3. Expected Results Please see attached snapshot ( User Picker Create New Issue ). Description field for UserPicker_Test type should show as a text link not the HTML code. h3. Actual Results Please see attached snapshot ( User Picker Create New Issue ). If you check this image, you will see SelectList field "Atlassian Website" as a text link (this should be the actual result for User Picker Field type) where UserPicker_Test is showing the HTML code. h3. Workaround Add the following line to */atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/fields/edit/edit-userpicker.vm* and restart Jira: {code} #disable_html_escaping() {code}

h3. Problem Definition
When you access any dashboard in JIRA that is not in your list of favorite dashboards, you get the following prompt:
bq. This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu. To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favorite on the Manage Dashboards page.
This prompt can be dismissed but it will keep re-occurring every time you access a page that is not a favorite, even if you simply refresh the page after dismissing the pop-up.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a way to disable this popup - either on a global level (which would apply to all users and all dashboards)
* or *preferably* as a personal setting (either made available under manage dashboards area or profile area); Or perhaps a "don't notify me again" option for each dashboard.

fields.description:
We have recently discovered a bug in JIRA that is affecting our add-on directly and can even lead to loss of information.

This problem is related with custom fields and how are they cached by JIRA. Upon startup (PluginEnabledEvent) our add-on installs multiple custom fields. It matches those custom fields by ID as we store this ID the first time a custom field is created.

JIRA caches all custom field objects as they are accessed but, if the Custom Field Type is not available, JIRA still caches these custom fields as CacheObject.NULL. All the following requests for a custom field in these conditions will return null. 

Some add-ons, will load all custom fields upon startup (e.g PluginEnabledEvent) using, for instance, the method CustomFieldManager#getCustomFieldObjects().

If one of these add-ons is enabled before our add-on, it will cache all our custom fields as NULL. Hence, when our add-on is enabled, the custom fields searched by ID return NULL leading the add-on to install them again, creating duplicated custom fields.

This behaviour only applies when JIRA is restarted.

We have found that this problem is affecting other add-ons as well that, just like us, are checking if their custom fields are installed using the ID.

Our current fix is clearing the custom fields cache when the add-on is enabled.

Hope this get's fixed ASAP. Thank you.
fields.summary: Custom fields are cached as null

h3. Summary

Permission helper showing that Anonymous users do not have access to JIRA even though Administrator have given *Browse Project*, "Create Issue* and *Assignable User* permissions to *Anyone*

Even though permission helper showing that anonymous users do not have browser project permission, users can browse project anonymously.

 !PH1.png|thumbnail!  !PH2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
7.0.0, 7.02

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Add permission to *Browse Project*, "Create Issue* and *Assignable User* for *Anyone*
2) Check for anonymous user permission in permission helper from any issue page.
3) Permission helper showing anonymous user do not have access.

h3. Expected Results

Permission helper showing that anonymous users are given browse project permission.

h3. Actual Results

Permission helper showing anonymous user do not have access.

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Permission Helper showing inaccurate information for Anonymous access

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47657].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the velocity Chart only shows the velocity of the team. The velocity can be estimated as the average, over several recent sprints, of the sum of the estimates for the amount of work completed by a team per sprint — For example, the velocity = (37 + 47 + 50 +57) / 4 = 48. However, we aren't given information of velocity value per member of the team.

h3. Suggested Solution
The velocity Charts should also include velocity value based on number of members. Eg: If there were 3 members in the team:
48 / 3 (people) = 16 (this is velocity value based on # of member of the team).
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want Velocity Chart to also display the velocity value based on number of members

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we will have to one by one change the ownership of individual filters and dashboards from one user to anther. Hi Support,

We have received several report about the problem of license of our Plugin after an upgrade of JIRA. We know the workaround is to apply another license and reapply the valid license:
    1. Get another license such as an evaluation, no matter if it is valid or expired. 
    2. Apply it using Manage AddOn of JIRA  
    3. Reapply your commercial license. 

I remember you have handled already some cases. Here is the last case we get from customer. 
https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/CA-234744
who complains the capability of the support since he is kept between us:
   1. Our support said "The license manage is managed by JIRA, it is out of our control. You should contact the Support of Atlassian".
   2. Your support said "it is the third-part, you should contact the support of plugin vendor". 
(we have no permission to access it. this why I create a new one).
 
He has reasonably requested we fixed the problem and prevent this infinit loop. 

*We think our both support teams should work closely once there is a problem with our Plugin. We should get notified when a ticket is created with our plugin.*

Of course, we should work with Atlassian developper team to fix this problem definitively. This is why I have created a bug here:
https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ATLASSDK-19

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47631].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Catch Email Address field in Incoming Handlers is case sensitive to the local_part (before the at sign). That means that if the catch email is set to user@domain.com and an email is sent to User@domain.com, this email will be rejected, as the catch email won't match.

Though this is correct according to the RFC 2821, several email servers don't consider this part case sensitive. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make JIRA Catch Email completely case insensitive. 

h3. Workaround 
You have have several version or emails addresses with different cases that are used, add a handler with a different catch email for each. For example:
* user@domain.com
* User@domain.com
* USER@domain.com
fields.summary: Make JIRA Catch Email Case Insensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47628].
  {panel}

We have a Team in our organization that has a use case for managing permissions at a sub-project level (the term sub-project is being used loosely here - for their purposes it could be a component or a version, etc.).

Supposing there are user bases UB1 and UB2 (a set of users/groups/project roles), and sub-projects SB1 and SB2, and a hypothetical mapping that we have such that UB1 maps to SB1 and UB2 maps to SB2 - is it possible for us to set up permissions at the sub-project level such that users in UB1 would only see issues that correspond to SB1 and users in UB2 only see issues that correspond to SB2?

We would then want to extrapolate this such that one user base could map to multiple sub-projects and one sub-project could be accessible (i.e., the issues that correspond to the sub-project would be accessible) to multiple user bases and so on.

----
We have investigated the possibility of achieving this by using issue-level security in conjunction with JJUPIN scripts and have found that too complex and hard to maintain, especially with respect to scale. We have also investigated the [Issue Type Filter plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.youngaweb.jira.issue-type-ui-filter/server/overview], but found that it does not suit our purposes since our objective is not to limit a user base to a particular issue type, rather to create any issue type, but limit other users from seeing the created issues.
----
Thus, we were wondering if JIRA offered any way for us to have permission management at a component (sub-project) level such that visibility/management of issues could be controlled at that level as opposed to at a Project level. Or would the official recommendation in this case be to just create separate Projects for each of our sub-projects?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Permission Management at the Component Level

h3. Problem Definition
A new transition cannot be added to a status with no outgoing transitions to a draft workflow
Error *You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow* shown.
h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to add a transition to the last status which does not have any outgoing transitions.
h3. Workaround
Edit the workflow in a disabled state (Inactive Worflow).
fields.summary: Cannot Add Transitions in Draft Workflows

fields.description:
When you go from a filter to an issue and then click on a sub-task, you are not able to use the back option on the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue and a sub-task.
# Create a filter that displays the issue.
# Click on the issue on the filter results to open the issue. Notice that the URL will have {{?filter=<filterID>}} appended to the URL.
# While on the issue, click on the sub-task to open it.
# Now try to go back to the issue by using the back button.

h3. Expected Results

You go back to the issue.

h3. Actual Results

The URL in the browser updates, but you are not taken to the previous page.

h3. Additional notes

Reproducible on IE, Firefox, Safari
fields.summary: Unable to use back button after opening an issue from filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47623].
  {panel}

Hi,

Jira has various permissions for "Work log feature", but we are missing a "view" permission. This is a feature request to make it possible to configure, which groups/roles can see the worklog related fields (estimation, remaining estimate, spent time)


This would remove much overhead if you work together with a customer, but he should not see the work log related stuff.

Regards
Martin
fields.summary: Add "view" permission configuration for work log fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47621].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, there is no sizing standard for image logo across products. For example if you go to _Administration >> Look and Feel_ in different products:

* JIRA, the height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 30 px.
* Confluence, the height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 48 px.

This causes a _small_ discrepancy in the logo quality across products, assuming all using the same image file.

h3. Suggested Solution

Standardise the resize image logo across _all_ products.
 
h3. Workaround

Resize the image logo manually before uploading
fields.summary: Standardise image logo sizing across all products

fields.description:
When there is a long list of items in the Fix Version or Affects Version fields (and possibly others) in JIRA, it shows a number in parens that says (in mouse hover) "Click to view more".  But this isn't showing up in Chrome.  What is interesting is that the page renders first with the entire list of items (on two lines), then it re-renders showing the list followed by the number in parens, then re-renders again with the number in parens hidden.

When I should see this: *Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, ... (6)*

JIRA instead displays this: *Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun,* 

I see this problem in all browsers using Chromium backend, Firefox doesn't seem affected.
fields.summary: When many Fix Versions, click to view more number in parenthesis is hidden

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47618].
  {panel}

When calculating (checking) project permissions Permission helper (neither opened from the project page nor the one from the issue page Admin menu) doesn't consider "Granted to" items except "Project role". That says, that if the user A is in the X group and you give the ADD COMMENTS permission to this X group, there will be ability to add comments to this A user, but the Permission Helper says there is no permission because the A user does not have ... project role.

Example:
1. "Add comments" permission is added to toldot-CTO group and to Project Lead:
 !Снимок экрана (110).png|thumbnail! 
2. User nisbor is Project Lead and is a member of toldot-CTO group:
 !Снимок экрана (111).png|thumbnail! 
3. Permission helper in this project shows that threr is no ability to add comments to user nisbor:
 !Снимок экрана (109).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Permission helper doesn't consider permissions to groups while checking permissions

fields.description:
Any valid JSON should be able to be set as entity properties and hence comment properties

However the current com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService.CommentParameters API uses JSONObject as input and hence it can ONLY accept json objects and not arrays or numbers or booleans or strings.

We need to improve the API so that it can take ANY valid JSON object, while maintaining backward compatibility for the JSONObject mistake.
fields.summary: JIRA Comments cannot have any JSON associate with them on create or update
